intro: Smelowskia alpina, commonly known as the alpine smelowskia, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species. Smelowskia alpina is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its ecological significance and potential medicinal properties.
